intro: Erysimum breweri, commonly known as the desert wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous flowers in early spring. Erysimum breweri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
